text:
Begum Kulsoom Nawaz Sharif (Urdu: بیگم كلثوم نواز شريف‬‎) (29 March 1950 – 11 September 2018) was a Pakistani politician. She was the First Lady of Pakistan three times; from 1990 to 1993, 1997 to 1999 and then from 2013 to 2017.
Kulsoom served as the President of Pakistan Muslim League-N (PML-N) from 1999 to 2002.<ref name="news18/29july2017">
Nawaz was diagnosed with lymphoma in August 2017 and since has been in treatment in London. In June 2018 Nawaz suffered a cardiac arrest and since has been placed on ventilator. On 11 September 2018, she died in London at the age of 68.
